tool_description: Comprehensive dice roller for tabletop RPGs supporting all standard dice types (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, d100) with modifiers, advantage/disadvantage, and roll statistics

available_commands.description: Roll dice using standard notation (XdY+Z format)

arguments.name: notation
arguments.description: Dice notation in format XdY+Z where X=count (1-100), Y=sides (4/6/8/10/12/20/100), Z=modifier (optional, can be negative)

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: Optional modifier to add to the result (can be negative)

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: Optional modifier to add to the result (can be negative)

available_commands.description: Calculate theoretical statistics for a dice roll

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: Number of recent rolls to display (default: 10, max: 100)

tool_usage_guidance: Standard notation: XdY+Z where X=dice count, Y=sides, Z=modifier (optional)
Supported dice: d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, d100
Modifiers can be positive (+5) or negative (-2)
Statistics command shows min, max, average, and probability distribution
History tracks last 100 rolls with full details
Examples: '3d6+5' (3 six-sided dice plus 5), '2d20' (2 twenty-sided dice), '1d100-10' (percentile minus 10)
proactive_triggers: When user asks to roll dice or make a roll
When user mentions D&D, Pathfinder, or other tabletop RPGs
When user asks about attack rolls, saving throws, ability checks
When user mentions advantage or disadvantage
When user needs to generate random numbers for gaming
When discussing character stats or damage calculations
When user asks 'what would I roll for [action]'
When setting up combat or skill challenges

metadata.notes: Full-featured dice roller for tabletop RPGs. Supports all standard polyhedral dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, d100) with modifiers, advantage/disadvantage mechanics, roll history, and statistical analysis. Perfect for D&D, Pathfinder, and other tabletop games.
